New Records: Golden State Warriors achieved their 14th straight regular-season win over the Houston Rockets.
Tari Eason scored a career-high 27 points.
Key Match Events: The Warriors squandered a 31-point lead before winning in overtime.
Golden State scored the first six points in overtime to make it 125-119.
Jabari Smith Jr. hit a 3-pointer to cut the lead to 119-117 with 15.5 seconds to go in regulation.
Aaron Holiday stole the ball from Draymond Green, leading to Green fouling out.
Tari Eason made two free throws to send the game to overtime.
Jonathan Kuminga scored the first two baskets of overtime to make it 123-119.
Houston made just 1 of 12 shots in overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors continued to win without Steph Curry, improving to 5-1 this season.
The team will re-evaluate Curry's sprained left ankle on Sunday.
Houston Rockets played much better after halftime but couldn't close out the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Andrew Wiggins returned after missing two games with a strained back and added 15 points.
